item.title: Actress Yetunde Bakare Slams Those Mocking Blossom Chukwujekwu's New Wife
item.description: Nollywood actress Yetunde Bakare has slammed netizens mocking Nollywood actor Blossom Chukwujekwu and his new wife, Ehinome Akhuemokhan. A few hours after the wedding photos made rounds on social media, Blossom Chukwujekwe was subjected to ridicule over the look of his new wife. While some netizens claimed the new wife, Ehinome Akhuemokhan looks older than him, others say Maureen Esisi is prettier than her. Amidst the criticism, Yetunde Bakare who seemed displeased over the negative comments from some social media users reacted to it.

item.title: Freckle Tattoos Are The Latest Trend That's Puzzling The Internet
item.description: Freckle Tattoos Are The Latest Trend That's Puzzling The InternetBy Jaime LutzUpdated Nov. 18 2019, 2:20 p.m. ET You know what they've always said: Pain is beauty. People are willing to go to great lengths to look fabulous. But this new trend takes it to new extremes. We're not talking about roughing it in some painful heels. It's much worse. Yeah, so this is really something people are really doing: getting freckles tattooed on their face, in the same vein of cosmetic tattooing as eyebrow tattoos.

item.title: Kylie Jenner Latest News and Updates
item.description: Reality star and socialite Kylie Jenner is the daughter of Kris Jenner and Caitlyn Jenner, and half-sister to Kourtney, Kim, and Khloé Kardashian. She got her start alongside her famous family on the reality seriesKeeping Up With the Kardashians, which began filming when she was just 10 years old.  Kylie has gone on to become a "self-made" billionaire, thanks to the success of her beauty empire Kylie Cosmetics and her clothing line with sister Kendall Jenner, Kendall + Kylie.

item.title: Oyetola Defeats Aregbesolas Candidate, Wins APC Primary
item.description: The Governor of Osun State, Gboyega Oyetola on Saturday defeated the anointed candidate of the minister of Interior, Rauf Aregbesola, Moshood Adeoti, to emerge winner of the All Progressives Congress election in the state. The ruling party declared Oyetola as its candidate in the forthcoming election in the state. Naija News had earlier reported that three aspirants contested in the electoral process alongside the state Governor. The aspirants included former Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives, Lasun Yusuff and a former Secretary to the State Government, Moshood Adeoti.

item.title: Popular Actress Speaks On Dating Singer Ruger
item.description: Nollywood actress, Susan Pwajok has reacted to reports alleging that she was in a romantic relationship with Nigerian singer,Ruger. This comes after the singer admitted last year via an Instagram post that he was dating actress Susan Pwajok after his initial denial on Clout Africa’s Clout Talk Concert 2.0. His claim was trailed by disbelief on social media. He wrote: “So Susan Pwajok is my girlfriend. Y’all can get off her d*ck now, thank you.

item.title: Cameroonian Soldiers Invade Nigerian Village, Kill 70
item.description: More than 70 Nigerians were allegedly killed on Sunday, December 20, when Cameroonian troops reportedly invaded Kirawa-Jimni village in Gwoza local government area of Borno state. According to residents, over 70 people have been buried after soldiers of the Cameroonian army allegedly chased Boko Haram insurgents into their community. READ ALSO: How Boko Harm Attacks Have Devastated Children – UN [article_adwert] Many of the villagers have reportedly fled the community, following the incident which took place on Sunday, December 20.

item.title: Many Killed, Houses Burnt As Bandits Attack Kaduna Again
item.description: Bandits have again inflicted huge casualties on residents and indigenes of Kaduna State in a fresh attack on Friday that has left not less than 50 persons killed, many kidnapped, houses burnt and animals rustled. The fresh attack has been confirmed by the Police Public Relations Officer in Kaduna, ASP Mohammed Jalinge who added that more details are been expected about the incident. The affected communities, up to nine of them are located in Giwa Local Government Area of Kaduna State.

item.title: Origin of Yoruba race in Nigeria
item.description: African Yoruba people are numerous and well known. Yoruba history and the present life are very interesting topics for people all over the world. Even modern Nigerians who live in the big cities are wondering what the origin of Yoruba race is. You’ll find all the answers right now and right here. Origin of Yoruba tribeIn fact, there are lots of kindred nations. They are very numerous. There are more than 30 million of representatives belonging to the Negroid race and living in West Africa in the area of the river Niger.

item.title: Tinubu Directs Withdrawal Of Police Personnel From VIPs
item.description: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has directed the withdrawal of Police personnel serving as security details for Very Important Personalities (VIPs). The Minister of State for Police Affairs, Hajia Imaan Sulaiman-Ibrahim, made this known on Monday at a 2-Day Retreat for Directorate Cadre in the ministry held in Abuja. She said the mandate of the ministry includes amending the Nigerian Police Act, developing and implementing a harmonized police reform report, and developing a community policing strategy for the Nigeria Police Force (NPF).

item.title: Another APC Chieftain Dies On Campaign Flag-Off Day (Photo)
item.description: Another chieftain of the All Progressive Congress (APC)  in Lagos, Chief Juliana Dupeola Awodogan, popularly known as ‘Iya Oniyan’ is dead. Naija News reports that Iya Oniyan who was in her 70s died at the Lagos University Teaching Hospital (LUTH), on Tuesday which was the same day the APC held their campaign flag-off in Jos. ‘Iya Oniyan’ Her death came before an APC chieftain and a lawmaker at the Lagos House of Assembly, Sobur Olayiwola Olawale slumped and died in Jos, Plateau State.

item.description: - Raila Odinga amedai kuwa Jubilee inaihujumu kifedha kampuni ya usambazaji umeme humu nchini ya KPLC - Kulingana na Odinga, baadhi ya maafisa wa Jubilee wanatengeneza vikingi vya saruji na kuwaharibia soko wauzaji wa miti Habari Nyingine: Muthama asema anayemuunga mkono kati ya Mutua na Wavinya Ndeti Kiongozi wa muungano wa upinzani, Raila Odinga amekishtumu kitendo cha kampuni ya usambazaji stima ya KPLC, cha kuondoa vikingi vya miti na kutumia vikingi vya saruji badala yake.

item.title: Rotimi Amaechi Vows To Go Back To PDP If Jonathan Returns Oil Wells
item.description: Rotimi Amaechi, Governor of Rivers State and Chairman of the Nigerian Governors' Forum, has voiced his terms of returning to the Peoples Democratic Party. The Governor spoke today at a rally organized by the All Progressives Congress at the Liberation Stadium in Port Harcourt. Among other things, he stated he is ready to go back to the PDP should President Goodluck Jonathan give back Rivers State the oil wells that were ceded to the neighbouring Bayelsa State.

item.title: Uhuru na Raila wang'ang'ania vinono Magharibi mwa Kenya huku mchuano mkuu kati yao ukijongea (picha)
item.description: - Uhuru na Raila wamezidisha juhudi zao katika kuwavutia wapiga kura wa Magharibi mwa Kenya kabla ya uchaguzi - Uhuru alikutana na maelfu ya viongozi wa Magharibi mjini Kakamega mnamo Jumamosi Septemba 30, huku Raila akipiga kambi Vihiga – Eneo al Magharibi mwa Kenya linachukuliwa kuwa ngome ya upinzani lakini Jubilee imekuwa ikiliingilia pakubwa na ikashinda viti kadha vya ubunge katika uchaguzi Agosti 8 Rais Uhuru Kenyatta an hasimu wake wa NASA Raila Odinga wamepiga kambi katika eneo lenye wingi wa kura la Magharibi mwa Kenya kabla ya mchuano wao mkuu.

item.title: Death toll rises to 87 in Benishiek massacre by Boko Haram
item.description: Death toll of on September 17, 2013, Tuesday, has risen to 161, some 100 buildings burnt. First reports revealed that the insurgents, who disguised in military uniforms, killed 23 persons, while several others were declared missing. However, an official of Borno State Environment Protection Agency, Mallam Saidu Yakubu, confirmed on September 19, 2013 that “87 bodies were recovered in the bush and our people are still searching for more.” Officials of the Borno State Environmental Protection Agency (BOSEPA) confirmed this was in addition to 55 bodies earlier picked up on Wednesday.

item.title: 11 Gunned Down As Bandits Attack Kankara Community In Katsina
item.description: Not less than eleven persons have been shot dead in a fresh attack by bandit terrorists on a village in Katsina State. Naija News gathered the bandits late on Thursday night around 11.30pm, stormed Dan-Kumeji village in Kankara Local Government Area of Katsina State, and started shooting sporadically. As the villagers tried to escape into the bush, they, unfortunately, ran into an ambush set up by the attackers who opened fire on them.

item.title: Nigerian Actress Proposes To Become Ned Nwokos 8th Wife
item.description: Amid rumoured news about Nigerian politician, Ned Nwoko marrying a 7th wife, a Nigerian actress and social media entertainer, Esther Nwachukwu, has proposed to be the 8th wife of the billionaire. Naija News recalls that Nollywood actress, Regina Daniels who happens to be Nwoko’s 6th wife earlier denied reports that her husband is marrying a seventh wife. The wife of the billionaire in a recent post on her Instagram disclosed that the lady alleged to be her new rival is her friend.

item.title: Obasanjo Diabolically Double-Crossed Bisi Akande Buhari
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has accused former President Olusegun Obasanjo of using diabolical double-cross to cost the second term aspiration of All Progressives Congress chieftain, Bisi Akande. President Buhari on Thursday at the public presentation of the autobiography of Akande, titled: “My Participations,” in Lagos State claimed that Obasanjo’s diabolical acts ended Akande’s governorship aspiration. According to Buhari, the only governor who was not affected by the plan of the former President was Bola Tinubu, who was the governor of Lagos State at the time.

item.title: Wakenya wenzangu: Raila azungumza kuhusu hali yake kiafya
item.description: - Raila alitoa taarifa Jumatano na kuwashukuru Wakenya kwa jumbe zao za heri njema walipopata habari ameugua - Aliwahakikishia kuwa anaendelea kupata nafuu na kutaka wasiwe na hofu kuhusu hatma yake - Maswali hata hivyo yameibuka kuhusu hali yake mwili wake kiafya kwani ni safari ya tatu sasa kulazwa hospitali Kinara wa ODM Raila Odinga amezungumza kuhusu hali yake ya kiafya baada ya kulazwa hospitalini Jumanne Machi 9. Wakenya Jumatano waliamkia taarifa za wasiwasi kuhusu afya ya kiongozi huyo wa ODM na kuelezea hofu yao kupitia mitandao.

You can be compatible with someone and still go through unfortunate situations, or find yourself fighting for something that’s just not working. item.title: How to invite someone from Nigeria to USA
item.description: According to the U.S. federal law, Nigerian applicant must apply on their own for a visa to the United States. If you were thinking about traveling to the USA, you might need to know what documents are needed. A letter of invitation is a good way to prove that you are a reliable citizen who has a valid reason for visiting and is not expected to ruin the welfare and stability of the country.

item.title: USD Hits N600 At Parallel Market, Key Factors Identified
item.description: The parallel market yesterday closed with dollar to naira exchange at N600, Naija News understands. This is as Nigeria’s currency experienced further devaluation amid other crisis. Some of the key factors identified to be affecting the Dollar to Naira exchange includes election preparation, loss of confidence, and demand/supply. Stakeholders at the parallel market have expressed disappointment with little or no profit from exchanging dollar to Naira at a more cheaper price that N600.

item.description: The Minister of State for Labour and Employment, Festus Keyamo has reacted to the crowd that welcomed the All Progressives Congress (APC) presidential candidate, Bola Tinubu to Ogun State. Naija News reports that the presidential candidate earlier on Wednesday paid a visit to the former president, Olusegun Obasanjo, as part of his consultation ahead of the 2023 presidential election. Upon his arrival, a large crowd of supporters stormed Obasanjo’s penthouse residence displaying various placards, while singing songs to welcome him.

item.title: NFS Is an Important Acronym Everyone Trying Wizz Should Understand
item.description: The Wizz app allows you to connect with new people who may have similar interests as you, but what does the acronym NFS mean there? Source: WizzThe Gist: Wizz is a chat app that allows users to connect based on what they are interested in. NFS is an acronym many on the service use, and it means "need for speed," which is meant to indicate that a message being sent needs a fast reply or acknowledgment.

item.title: Nollywood Actress, Eniola Badmus Speaks On Committing Suicide For Being Plus Size
item.description: Plus size Nigerian movie actress, Eniola Badmus, has described as depressive some body-shaming comments by social media users on chubby women. The 43-year-old actress while speaking in a recent interview with Saturday beats said although some of the derogatory comments by netizens could cause some people to be depressed, and even commit suicide, but that she would not let that happen with her. Badmus noted that she did not come into the entertainment industry with a skinny body, hence she cannot allow negative comments about her body to get to her.

item.title: Tinubu Visits Buhari After APC Presidential Primaries [Photos]
item.description: The Presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Ahmed Tinubu, on Thursday night paid a thank-you-visit to President Muhammadu Buhari. Naija News reports that the APC flagbearer was at the Presidential Villa to thank President Buhari for allowing a free and fair APC Presidential primary election held on Tuesday and Wednesday at Eagle Square in Abuja. Those who accompanied Tinubu on the visit were Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu of Lagos State and his younger brother/ OANDO Chief Executive Officer, Wale Tinubu.

item.title: Aide Reacts To Allegation That Peter Obi Hates Northerners
item.description: Valentine Obienyem, the media aide to the Labour Party presidential candidate, Peter Obi has denied reports that his principal is a religious bigot that hates northerners. Obienyem in a statement on Thursday said some faceless groups ben sponsored by political opponents are responsible for spreading falsehood about Peter Obi due to his growing popularity. Naija News understands his statement comes as a reaction to an earlier article which claimed Obi didn’t respond appropriately to the killing of some northerners in Anambra State back in March 2006.

item.title: Nigeria Records 745 COVID-19 Cases, 280 In Lagos (See Breakdown)
item.description: Nigeria has recorded 745 new cases of coronavirus (COVID-19) in the West African country. Naija News reports that the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) confirmed this in a series of tweets on the micro-blogging site, Twitter on Thursday evening, June 18. According to the NCDC, of the seven hundred and forty-five new coronavirus cases recorded on Thursday evening, 280 were recorded in Lagos, Nigeria’s commercial city, Oyo-103 Ebonyi-72 FCT-60 Imo-46 Edo-34 Delta-33 Rivers-25 Kaduna-23 Ondo-16 Katsina-12 Kano-10 Bauchi-8 Borno-7 Kwara-5 Gombe-4 Sokoto-2 Enugu-2 Yobe-1 Osun-1 Nasarawa-1, northern Nigeria.

item.title: Nollywood Actress Opens Up On Why She Dates Older Men
item.description: Budding Nollywood actress, Uju Mandy, has opened up on reasons she dates men that are way older than her. Naija News reports that the movie star during an interview with PUNCH said she does not date her age mates or younger ones. She said, “I love matured men. They are my spec (preference). I cannot date someone who is of the same age with me. The man has to be way older than me”

item.title: Tinubu Lines Up 140 Officials To Assess Wike, Keyamo, Others
item.description: President Bola Tinubu has approved the appointment of 140 government officials to track and assess the performance of ministers and heads of agencies. A senior official working closely with the Central Delivery Coordination Unit headed by the Special Adviser to the President on Policy Coordination, Hadiza Bala-Usman, made this known in a chat with Punch. He revealed that the officers would also review the performance of federal ministries, departments, and agencies ahead of the first assessment exercise at the end of this month.

item.title: UTME: Kogi student shatters JAMB record, scores 399/400
item.description: Ibrahim Shamwifu, a young genius from Kogi state, has reportedly scored 399/400 in his Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME). The result obtained by Nigerian University Scholarships, a website that advertises academic opportunities, shows that the young man shattered a record of results for the examination body which it does not think anyone might be able to repeat in the next 10 years. Shamwifu, according to the website, scored 99 in Use of English, 100 in Physics, 100 in Biology and 100 in Chemistry with registration number 65184979HA and C40509045 as the exam code.

item.title: Benefits and functions of drama in society
item.description: Do you know the benefits and functions of drama in society? It is likely that you and another vast majority of people in the world treat it only as entertainment and enjoy it mainly for passing time. Even the connoisseurs of high art never thought about the social importance of drama. Scientists held various sociological research trying to find the roots of people's problems and the ways of its decision. But as it always happens, the answers are near, and we do not attach value to them.

N700m Scam: EFCC Confiscates Suspects 44 Houses
item.description: A Federal High Court sitting in Umuahia has granted a forfeiture order to the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, EFCC, to seize 44 houses belonging to eight persons who defrauded Union Bank of Nigeria Plc to the tune of N700 million. The order, which was given by Justice F. A. Olubanjo, affects the property of Chikezie Neoma Agbara, Amarachi Iroha, Lucy Nwosu and Glo Chizzy International Limited. Others are Nneamaka Raphael Iheabuchi, Nnamdi Nwosu, Ikechukwu Nwosu, Chukwu Chikezie and Oliver Ogbujie.

item.title: You Have No Business Getting Married If You're Wise, Rich Or Educated
item.description: Nigerian singer, Harrison Tare Okiri, popularly known as Harrysong, has claimed that Marriage is not for the rich, educated or wise. Naija News reports that Harrysong stated this in the wake of the marriage crash between Davido’s logistics manager, Isreal DMW and his wife, Shiela Courage. In the post via Instagram, the ‘Reggae Blues’ crooner said wealth and education cannot stop a marriage from breaking up; instead, humility, selflessness, patience and the ability to serve one’s partner.

item.title: Cape Verde Gains Three Points Against Ethiopia
item.description: Cape Verde began their Africa Cup of Nations campaign with a 1-0 victory over Ethiopia on Sunday with Julio Tavares scoring the game-winning goal. Cape Verde took the lead in the first half of the game in Yaounde after Ethiopia’s defender Yared Bayeh was sent off after just 12 minutes. Ethiopia faced an uphill battle after Bayeh’s yellow card was upgraded to a red following a VAR review of his tackle on Tavares as the Cape Verdean ran through on goal.

item.title: How Long Is 200 Moons in Disney Plus's 'Willow'?
item.description: Lucasfilm and Disney Plus's series reboot of Ron Howard's 1988 fantasy flick 'Willow' takes place "200 moons" later. How long is that exactly? Fans of Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, Game of Thrones, and pretty much any otherworldly franchise boasting cryptid creatures and magical powers will surely perk up to know that Lucasfilm and Disney Plus are rebooting 1988's Oscar-nominated film Willow. From series creator Jonathan Kasdan, Willow will once again center on the legendary sorcerer's (Warwick Davis) adventures in the vast land of Mother World.

item.title: President Tinubus Plan For Food Security, Inflation, Price Stability
item.description: The President Bola Ahmed Tinubu-led administration on Thursday declared a state of emergency on food security. Naija News reports that this was made known during a media briefing by the President’s special adviser on special duties, communications and strategy, Dele Alake. President Tinubu also identified measures to check food inflation and guarantee price stability. The president’s plans were conveyed in a speech delivered by Dele Alake, his special adviser on special duties, communications and strategy.

item.title: Tinubu Absent As Buhari Meets APC Stakeholders In Aso Rock
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari on Friday met with stakeholders of the All Progressives Congress (APC) at the Presidential Villa, Abuja. The presidential candidate of the party, Senator Bola Tinubu was conspicuously absent, Naija News reports. Those who attended the meeting are, the National Chairman of the party, Abdulahi Adamu; Senate President, Ahmad Lawan; Deputy Speaker, House of Representatives, Idris Wase, and presidential running mate of the party, Kashim Shettima. While some state governors elected under the party including Babagana Zulum (Borno); Atiku Bagudu (Kebbi); Abdullahi Sule (Nasarawa); Inuwa Yahaya (Gombe); Mai Mala Buni (Yobe); former Speaker, House of Representatives, Dimeji Bankole, and fomer minister of Agriculture, Audu Ogbeh.

item.title: 'The Lance Dance' ESPN's Michael Jordan Documentary
item.description: In 1997, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls were going after their sixth NBA title — but behind the scenes, tensions were high between the NBA star, coach Phil Jackson, and the team's front office, led by general manager Jerry Krause.  ESPN's The Last Dance explores the dynamics between Michael Jordan, his teammates — like Scottie Pippen and Dennis Rodman — and his rivals on and off the court. Plus, the 10-episode docu-series also dives deep into Michael's personal life including the murder of this father, James Jordan, and his reported gambling addiction.

item.title: Terror In The City Of Love: 12 Killed In Paris

item.title: Kwankwaso Reveals Reason He Dumped PDP, APC
item.description: The presidential candidate of the New Nigeria People’s party (NNPP), Rabiu Kwankwaso, has disclosed that the failure of the All Progressive Congress (APC) and the Peoples Democratic party (PDP) in putting Nigeria and Nigerians first is reason he left the parties. Naija News reports that the former member of the PDP and the APC made this known during an event on Maritime Agenda organized by the party on Tuesday. According to Kwankwaso, the two parties  “failed woefully” governing the country in the last 23 years.

item.title: Oscar Sudi Akerwa Baada ya DP Ruto Kutoalikwa Kusalimia Rais Suluhu
item.description: - Sudi alikasirika baada ya DP Ruto kunyimwa nafasi ya kumpokea Rais Samia aliye humu nchini - Aliwasili Jumanne Mei 4 na kupokelewa na maafisa wakuu serikalini huku DP akiwekwa pembeni na kulazimika kufuatilia ziara hiyo kupitia runinga - Sudi alisema hatua ya Ikulu kwa DP ni madharau makuu kutoka kwa Rais aliyeahidi 2013 kuunganisha taifa wa Kapseret Oscar Sudi amekashifu Rais Uhuru Kenyatta baada ya ripoti kuwa naibu wake William Ruto hakualikwa kumpokea Rais wa Tanzania Samia Suluhu.

item.title: Rumor Claims Walmart Will Stop Selling Physical Xbox Games in 2024
item.description: As Xbox sets its eyes on going digital, physical retailers such as Walmart are rumored to discontinue selling physical copies starting in 2024. Source: XboxThe Gist: CEO of Limited Run Games, Josh Fairhurst, claimed on Twitter that Walmart is reportedly "dropping physical Xbox games soon," following news of Best Buy ending physical media sales at the end of Q1 2024.Gamers are convinced this trend is the "end of an era" and will hurt game preservation.

item.title: 'Home Alone' Conspiracy Theories Are a Thing and Some of Them Actually Make Sense
item.description: 'Home Alone' conspiracy theories are a thing for longtime fans. Some of them that actually make sense, while others are just ridiculous. Source: 20th Century FoxFor many of us, Home Alone is a holiday staple. But, like a lot of classic kids' movies, over the years, fans have dreamed up wild theories that paint a different picture of the memory we have of Kevin McAllister and his antics in the face of a home invasion.

item.title: AGF Malami Denies Ordering DSS Attack On Sunday Igboho's Residence
item.description: The Attorney-General of the Federation (AGF) and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami (SAN) has denied directing the Department of State Services, DSS, to attack the residence of Sunday Igboho. Naija News recall that the DSS had on July 1st attacked Sunday Igboho’s residence in Soka Ibadan, killing two people and arresting many others. Igboho had gone into hiding after escaping the attack by the Nigerian secret police. He was however arrested in Benin Republic while trying to board a flight to Germany alongside his wife, Ropo.

item.title: Emily Skinner (TV Actress) - Age, Family, Bio
Irene Ryan - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Played Granny on the Beverly Hillbillies and also had notable success in film and on the Broadway stage. Before Fame A popular vaudeville actress, she accompanied Bob Hope on the USO tours, billed as the "the gal who makes Bob Hope laugh." Trivia After the end of the Beverly Hillbillies in 1971, she was offered a role on television similar to the Granny character she was playing, but she set it aside to fulfill her dream to act on Broadway.

item.title: Why Aggrieved APC Senators May Shelve Defection Plan To PDP
item.description: The cold war between the presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar, and some state governors led by Nyesom Wike of Rivers State has made the main opposition party unattractive for Senators elected on the platform of the All Progressives Congress (APC) who were planning to defect. Naija News understands that the planned defection by 15 APC senators may not see the light of day following warnings that they risk losing their seats and the crisis rocking the PDP.

item.title: "When OBO Gives You $10k": Eko Hotel Staff Ngozi Gets Special Reception At Bank, Opens Dollar Accoun
item.description: A video posted by Fidelity Bank Plc showed when Ngozi Kwekwaru visited one of its branches to open a dollar accountIn the video, Ngozi was seen receiving special treatment from the staff of the bank when she arrived to deposit her dollarsThe bank congratulated Ngozi, who got $10k from musician, Davido, as a reward for returning the $70k she found at Eko HotelsA TikTok video posted by Fidelity Bank Plc showed when Ngozi Kwekwaru visited one of its branches.

item.title: BNXN Apologizes To Davido After Disrespecting Him On Social Media
item.description: Nigerian musician, Daniel Etiese Benson, popularly known as BNXN, has issued an apology following a reprimand from his colleague, Dremo, for his perceived ‘disrespect’ towards DMW boss, David Adeleke (Davido). Naija News understands that BNXN had made a subtle dig at Davido during a playful exchange with a fan of the DMW boss on X on Thursday. The social media remark, however, did not settle well with Davido as the renowned singer and producer decided to remove a tweet in which he playfully hinted at a potential collaboration with BNXN.

item.title: Hardship: Let Women Lead Your Economic Recovery Efforts
item.description: Ohanaeze Ndigbo, an Igbo socio-cultural group, has urged President Bola Tinubu to appoint women to lead the nation towards economic recovery. Naija News reports that  Ohanaeze in a statement released on Friday suggested that a female Nigerian economist with international expertise can keep the country from impending tragedy. According to Ohanaeze’s factional secretary-general, Okechukwu Isiguzoro, women are disproportionately impacted by the current economic downturn. The statement read, “The harsh reality on the ground paints a dire picture: Nigerian women are disproportionately impacted by the ongoing crisis.

item.title: Tinubu Has Paid His Dues, I Wont Politically Shoot Him Down
item.description: Ayodele Fayose has described Bola Ahmed Tinubu, the national leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), as one of the greatest builders of men in Yoruba land and Nigeria at large. The chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) said this in Ado Ekiti on Saturday while speaking with journalists as part of the events commemorating his 60th birthday. Fayose who stated that Tinubu has paid his due politically vowed not to join political enemies of the former Lagos State Governor to shoot him down.

item.title: What Happened to Heidi Fleiss? Here's Where She Is Today
item.description: Remember Heidi Fleiss? Here's What She's up to TodayBy Devan McGuinnessJun. 17 2020, Updated 11:40 p.m. ET Source: Getty / Shahar Azran There are very few people who ever get famous enough to have a movie made about them or a book written about their life. But Heidi Fleiss became a trending topic around the world long before social media put people into the spotlight faster than ever. While it's been a while since we've heard the name, people want to know what happened to Heidi Fleiss?

item.title: Farrah Fawcett - Trivia, Family, Bio

Trivia She was nominated for an Emmy Award for her portrayal of Francine Huges in the 1984 film The Burning Bed.

item.title: I Turned Down An Opportunity To Work In The Ministry Of Petroleum For Skit Making
item.description: Popular Nigerian skit maker, Sophia Chisom, better known as ‘Soso The Pure Water Seller’, has opened up on the career opportunity she gave up for comedy. The skit maker in an interview with BBC pidgin revealed that she is a Political science and Public Administration graduate from the University of Port Harcourt. Soso disclosed that she served in the Ministry of Petroleum as a corps member and had a great chance of getting retained but she backed off owing to the fact that she never wanted a 9-5 job.

item.title: Roman Abramovich Hands Over Chelsea
item.description: Roman Abramovich, billionaire owner of English Premier League side Chelsea, has handed over the club to the trustees of its charitable foundation. The decision was reached following Russia’s invasion of its neighbouring country, Ukraine. The Russian who took over the West-London club in 2003 noted that over the years in charge he has always ensured that the club is successful and playing a positive role in its communities. Abramovich in a statement released on Saturday wrote, “During my nearly 20-year ownership of Chelsea FC, I have always viewed my role as a custodian of the club, whose job it is ensuring that we are as successful as we can be today, as well as build for the future, while also playing a positive role in our communities.

The multi-hyphenate artist, who broke onto the scene with his endearingly vulnerable raps, is looking to take that same vulnerability to another level, and his namesake show Dave is allowing him to do just that.

item.title: Lookman And Osimhen On Target As Napoli Defeat Atalanta
item.description: Super Eagles players, Ademola Lookman, and Victor Osimhen both had a goal and an assist as Napoli defeated Atalanta 2-1 in Serie A tie on Saturday at the Gewiss Stadium. Super Eagles’ talisman, Osimhen, has already scored eight goals in nine Serie A contests, compared to Lookman’s six goals in the Italian domestic league. Additionally, in Atalanta’s previous six league games, Lookman has scored five goals for La Dea. Atalanta’s first opportunity came in the third minute, when Lookman crossed from the left for Rasmus Hojlund, forcing Alex Meret into a one-on-one save.

item.description: These are the TV moments that defined the decade. They're heartwarming, hilarious, and moving. They're moments we'll be thinking about far after we leave the 2010s behind. The 2010s were a disaster in a lot of ways, but TV wasn't one of them. Some of the best TV in the history of the medium happened in the 2010s. item.title: Banky W's Cheating Scandal With Ex-Signee, Niyola Is Not True
item.description: The report about Nigerian singer cum politician, Banky W and his former signee, Niyola has been confirmed to be false. Naija News reports that on Saturday, June 24, reports made the rounds online that Banky W allegedly cheated on his wife, Adesua Etomi. According to the Instagram blogger who broke the news, Banky W impregnated his side chic and asked her to abort the pregnancy but she refused, especially as she has previously aborted two pregnancies for him.

item.title: Ohanaeze Reveals Date To Choose Among Tinubu, Atiku And Obi
item.description: The apex Igbo socio-political organization, Ohanaeze Ndigbo is set to decide on the candidate the group will support during the 2023 presidential election in Nigeria. Naija News gathered that the decision will be confirmed during the 2022 Igbo Day celebration on September 29 in Aba, Abia State. According to a statement by the Secretary-General of Ohanaeze Ndigbo, Mazi Okechukwu Isiguzoro, sons, daughters and leaders from the seven Igbo-speaking states are expected at the event.

item.title: Soludo Gives Reasons Peter Obi Can't Win 2023 Presidency
item.description: The Anambra State Governor, Charles Soludo on Monday declared categorically that the Labour Party (LP) candidate, Peter Obi can’t win the 2023 presidential election in Nigeria. According to Soludo, Obi knows the game he is playing, they also know the game but one thing that is clear is that he can’t win the 2023 polls. The incumbent Anambra State Governor added further that Obi is paving the way for the All Progressives Congress (APC) candidate, Bola Tinubu to have a clear path to the presidency because he is taking votes away from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP).

For three decades, she became one of England’s sweethearts, hosted many TV shows, published multiple best-selling books, and even received an MBE for her services to broadcasting.

item.title: I Was Expecting To Win At Supreme Court
item.description: Nasarawa State Governor, Abdullahi Sule has revealed that he foresaw his victory at the Supreme Court before the ruling on the state’s governorship election legal tussle was delivered. Naija News reports that Sule made this revelation while speaking on Channels TV’s Politics Today on Friday. He detailed that the verdict from the Appeal  Court and one of the split rulings at the state’s election petition tribunal gave him confidence that the Supreme Court would rule in his favour.

Why Buhari Ordered Ministers With Political Ambitions To Resign Presidency
item.description: The Presidency has given reasons why President Muhammadu Buhari ordered Ministers and political appointees contesting in the 2023 general elections to resign. Recall that Buhari had during Wednesday’s Federal Executive Council (FEC) meeting asked Ministers to resign on or before Monday 16th, May 2022. In a circular on Thursday, Buhari also directed all heads of agencies, departments, parastatals and ambassadors with political ambitions to turn in their resignations. The Secretary to the Government of the Federation, Boss Mustapha signed the circular which directed all heads of agencies with political ambition to resign.

item.title: Woman Blasts Bosses Getting Angry at Workers Who Leave on Time

Some 34% of Americans have been reported as having side hustles, aka second or third part-time jobs in order to make ends meet, and 64% of US citizens have also said that they are living paycheck to paycheck.

item.title: Shehu Sani Makes Fresh Claims On 2023 Elections
item.description: Former Kaduna Central lawmaker, Shehu Sani, has made a fresh claim about events following the conduct of the 2023 general elections. In a post via his Twitter page on Wednesday evening, Senator Sani recalled that the 781 election offenders reportedly arrested nationwide by police operatives have all been released. Naija News reports that Sani said this in reaction to the ongoing controversy about an Anambra State teenager, Mmesoma Ejikeme, who was accused by the Joint Admission and Matriculation Board (JAMB) of allegedly manipulating her 2023 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME) results and inflating the scores from 249 to 362.

item.title: Shell Suspends Multibillion-Dollar Assets Sale In Nigeria
item.description: Shell Group has suspended the divestment of its interest in Nigeria subsidiary-Shell Petroleum Development Company. The Managing Director of SPDC and Chairman, Osagie Okunbor, in a statement released on Thursday, said the sale of the assets had been put on hold pending the outcome of its appeal at the Supreme Court. The statement partly reads, “The Shell Group has confirmed separately that it will not progress the divestment of its interest in SPDC until the outcome of SPDC’s appeal.

item.title: AGN President, Rollas Reveals What Killed Mr Ibu
item.description: The Nigerian entertainment industry is in mourning following the passing of celebrated actor John Okafor, widely known by his stage name Mr Ibu. The beloved comedian and actor died at the age of 62 due to cardiac arrest, as confirmed by his long-time manager, Don Nwuzor, through an announcement made by Emeka Rollas, the president of the Actors Guild of Nigeria (AGN), on Instagram. The post reads, “Mr Ibu suffered cardiac arrest according to his manager for 24 years Mr Don Single Nwuzor.

item.title: Ganduje: Reopening The Dollar Video Case Is Contempt Of Court
item.description: A Former Kano State Attorney General and Commissioner for Justice, Barrister Musa Abdullahi Lawal, has stated that the alleged move to reopen the dollar video case of former governor Abdullahi Ganduje is an act of ignorance. Naija News understands that certain reports making the rounds have indicated that the reinstated Kano Anti-Corruption Commission boss, Barrister Muhyi Magaji Rimin Gado might decide to reopen the case. Reacting to the reports, via an interview monitored by Naija News on Thursday, the former attorney general insisted that it is not proper to open an investigation into a case that is before a Federal Appeal Court in Abuja.

item.title: July 24 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: Your sign's planetary ruler is the Sun and as you were born in the first Decan, or part, of the sign, the Sun has twice the influence over you. Being the planet of integration, the Sun powers an individualist spirit, creativity and willpower within you. You often decline the assistance of others, knowing that you are the best person to handle a given task. If this tendency goes unchecked, it runs the risk of transforming into arrogance, but when used properly it is one of your greatest tools for success.

item.title: What Is Linus Sebastian's Net Worth?
item.description: What is Linus Sebastian's net worth? The tech news YouTuber created Linus Tech Tips, which is now at the center of multiple controversies. There are all sorts of outlets you could get your tech news from but over 15 million gearheads out there get it from Linus Tech Tips. This YouTube channel touts itself as a team of "professionally curious" tech experts and is home to thousands of tech reviews and discussions that aim to provide tech consumers with some suggestions and commentary on what to get and how to manage one's technology.

item.title: Woman Runs Hospice for Senior Dogs to Make the End of Their Lives as Comfortable as Possible
item.description: This Woman Takes in Abandoned Hospice Dogs to Make Their Last Days Their BestBy Robin ZlotnickUpdated July 31 2019, 1:16 p.m. ET Source: FacebookOften, when families can't afford to talk care of their ailing, elderly dogs, or when their beloved family pet starts to lose control over their faculties, they decide to give them up. Suddenly, these dogs, who've had wonderful lives until this point, end up alone, sick, and scared in shelters.

item.title: 'Ritualists Caught With Human Head Burnt In Front Of Police Station
item.description: Irate youths in Oja-Odan, Yewa North Local Government Area of Ogun State have set ablaze two suspected ritualists caught with a human head. The police operatives had earlier detained the suspects identified as Idowu Afolabi and Johnson Adebiyi at Oja Odan police station on Saturday. It was reported that youths in the community who were not pleased with the development reportedly broke into the police cell to drag out the two suspected ritualists.

item.description: - The US government lauded the work of the local authorities and all humanitarian officials supporting the victims - It stated it was directly helping victims of the landslide alongside Kenya Red Cross Society - The landslide occurred on Saturday, November 23, with the death toll surpassing 50 - Interior CS Matiang'i confirmed the government also provided relief supplies to the affected families The United States government has provided financial help directly to the West Pokot survivors of the deadly mudslide that left more than 50 dead on Saturday, November 23.

item.title: Why I Have Not Released New Song- Chike
item.description: Nigerian soul singer, Chike has given reasons why he has not released any songs in a while. The 29-year-old singer and songwriter made it known during an interview with a popular media personality, Dadaboy Ehiz on Apple Music 1. According to the singer, promoting music in Nigeria is more expensive as an independent artist, so rather than put in a lot of money promoting one song in which one may have no idea if the market will like it, it is better to use the money to push an album.

item.title: Eight Anambra LP Lawmakers Forfeit Salary For Six Months
item.description: Eight Labour Party (LP) members in the Anambra House of Assembly have forfeited their salaries for the next six months. The lawmakers are Nkechi Ogbuefi, Henry Mbachu, Jude Ifeanyi Umennajiego, Fred Ezenwa, Justice Azuka, Paul Obu and Patrick Okafor. In a statement on Friday, the lawmakers said they took the decision as part of their contribution to alleviating the economic hardship on citizens. The lawmakers called on President Bola Tinubu and all other governors of the 36 states to suspend work on other sectors and declare a state of emergency on security and hunger.

PDP's Adeleke Receives Certificate Of Return
item.description: The Independent National Electoral Commission on Wednesday presented the certificate of return to the governorship candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party, Ademola Adeleke, who won the 16th July gubernatorial election in Osun State. It The National Commissioner for INEC, supervising Osun, Ogun and Oyo states, Prof. Kunle Ajayi, presented the certificate to Adeleke and the deputy governor-elect, Kola Adewusi. The electoral body presented the certificate 72 hours after Adeleke defeated the incumbent governor, Gboyega Oyetola of the All Progressives Congress.

item.title: FG Sends Warning To All Citizens, List 58 Illegal Universities In Nigeria
item.description: The federal government of Nigeria has sent warning to all Nigerians especially those planning on attending  Universities by sending a list of illegal institution. National University Commission(NUC) has stated on its website that the federal government has shut down nothing less than 58 universities across Nigeria. The universities were closed for disobeying the Education (National Minimum Standards, etc.) Act CAPE3 Law of the Federation of Nigeria 2004. The federal government sent the message through the NUC secretary to all citizens, undergraduate and prospective university students.

item.title: Nigeria Is Close To Defeating Ebola, 1 Confirmed Case Left
item.description: Nigeria is really close to getting rid of the deadly Ebola virus disease, as only one confirmed case remains in the country. This optimism was expressed by the Minister of Health, Onyebuchi Chukwu, on August 26, 2014, Thursday. PremiumTimes report that this message has been conveyed by the minister, who was represented by the spokesman, Dan Nwomeh, in a press statement released this afternoon. Chukwu revealed that only one Ebola patient remained in isolation in Lagos, down from the 13 officially-confirmed cases in the country.

item.title: Ex-Katsina Council Chairman Arrested For Working With Bandits
item.description: The Katsina Police Command has arrested the former Caretaker Chairman of Jibia Local Government Area of the state, Haruna Mota, for colluding with bandits in carrying out attacks in the state. Gambo said the ex-chairman has been arrested and charged to court for aiding and abetting banditry and other sundry crimes in the state.

item.description: A team of medical personnel from China has arrived Nigeria touching down at the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja on Wednesday. The 15- member team was received by the Chinese Ambassador to Nigeria, Dr Zhou Pingjian; Executive Director, China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation, Mr Jacques Liao as well as senior officials of the Ministries of Foreign Affairs, Health. The doctors and nurses numbering about 15 arrived with some medical supplies.

item.title: Players Pay Tribute To Cardiff City Star, Emiliano Sala
item.description: Top players in Football have been paying their tribute to Cardiff City star, Emiliano Sala after his body was found in the wreckage of a plane which crashed. Recall that Naija News had reported that a body which was recovered from the wreckage of a plane in the English Channel was identified as Sala, according to the Dorset police on Thursday. The plane, which was carrying the 28-year-old Argentine footballer and pilot David Ibbotson, 59, went missing from radar near Guernsey two weeks ago.

item.title: Why Do Critics All Seem to Hate Pretty Smart on Netflix?

item.title: Bauchi Speaker, Abubakar Sulaiman Defects To PDP
item.description: Bauchi State House of Assembly Speaker, Abubakar Sulaiman has renounced his membership with the All Progressive Congress, APC. The lawmaker announced his defection to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) on Saturday, Naija News understands. Sulaiman made his defection known during the Ramadan Iftar (breaking of fast) hosted by the State governor, Senator Bala Abdulkadir Mohammed, for PDP stakeholders from Ningi, Toro, Warji and Dass Local Government Areas of the State at the Government House, Bauchi.

item.title: Four Person Killed, Many Injured As Security Men Shoot At Protesters At Lekki Toll Gate
item.description: Four persons have been confirmed dead and many others injured as security operatives opened fire on unarmed protesters at the Lekki Toll Gate area of Lagos. Recall NaijaNews reported that security officials on Tuesday evening reportedly opened fire on peaceful protesters that overstayed the 4pm curfew declared by the Lagos State government. It was reported that before the shooting began, the floodlights that lighted up the area went off, throwing the area into darkness.

item.title: Its Too Late For APC To Amend, Buni's Actions Were Ilegal
item.description: A chieftain of All Progressives Congress (APC), Hon. Salisu Kainuwa Tsafe has said the current crisis rocking the ruling party may not be resolved soon. Naija News understands that APC’s National Convention is scheduled to hold on March 26 and the party is yet to overcome cracks over its leadership. Speaking ahead of the convention, which is now less than twelve days, Tsafe who was a former leader, Zamfara State House of Assembly, noted that Governor Mai Mala Buni-led’s caretaker committee went outside the party’s constitutional provisions in its operations.

item.title: Ogun PDP Guber Candidate, Ladi Adebutu Arraigned In Court
item.description: The candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in the last governorship election in Ogun State, Ladi Adebutu, was arraigned before the State High Court in Abeokuta on Tuesday. Naija News reports that Adebutu and nine others were arraigned by the federal government over alleged money laundering. However, at the court sitting today, the government made changes to the charges filed against the PDP chieftain and the other defendants. These amendments were made in order to include Adebutu in the ongoing case that was initiated in July 2023, which accuses him of financially influencing voters during the March 18 election.

item.description: A tragic incident occurred in Plateau State on Monday, resulting in three children battling for survival at the Jos University Teaching Hospital (JUTH) after enduring severe injuries caused by their stepmother pouring scalding water on them. Reports revealed that the distressing incident took place in the vicinity of Gibiya Street, near New Market Road in the bustling metropolis of Jos. According to The Sun, the perpetrator, the first wife whose identity remains undisclosed, is currently evading authorities as she surreptitiously infiltrated the room where the innocent children were peacefully slumbering, proceeding to pour the scorching contents of her boiling pot onto them.

item.description: An Ambassador of African Union (AU) Agenda 2063, Ousmane Yara, on Sunday revealed how the Nigeria President-elect, Bola Tinubu was made a citizen of Guinea. Yara in an interview with Daily Sun in a highbrow Abuja hotel on Sunday also spoke on the relationship between Tinubu and a former president of Guinea, Alpha Conde. The Guinean, while speaking on a viral video showing Tinubu and Lagos State Governor, Babajide Sanwo-Olu, in a helicopter belonging to the Guinean government, said the video was recorded in 2016.

item.title: JUST IN: INEC Nullifies Southern Ijaw Election
item.description: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has nullified Saturday’s Bayelsa state governorship election in Southern Ijaw local government area, Premium Times Reports. Although parts of the votes from the election have been counted, the cancelled votes in the Southern Ijaw local government area will make the elections inconclusive. READ ALSO: Bayelsa Poll: Southern Ijaw LGA Tears PDP, APC Apart As Buhari Gets Stern Warning [article_adwert] According to reports, INEC nullified the election due to violence during the election in the area, the abduction of electoral officials and ballot box snatching.

item.title: Former EFCC Boss Magu Set To Be Promoted To AIG Ahead Of Retirement
item.description: A former acting Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC), Ibrahim Magu, is reportedly set to be promoted to the rank of Assistant Inspector-General of Police (AIG). Naija News understands that Magu, the most senior Commissioner of Police, was recommended for promotion by the Inspector-General of Police, Usman Alkali Baba. Following his recommendation for promotion, the Police Service Commission (PSC) is set to elevate him to the post of AIG ahead of his retirement from the force on May 5.

item.title: Do You Have to Be Mormon to Be in the Tabernacle Choir?
item.description: Formerly known as the Mormon Tabernacle Choir, the singing group holds auditions — and a rigorous 16-week training — in Salt Lake City every year. The Gist: To join the Tabernacle Choir — and be a part of the group’s famous Christmas concerts — singers must be members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in good standing.Applicants also must be between 25 and 55 years of age and live within 100 miles of the Salt Lake Tabernacle.

item.description: Will there be a sequel to 'Teen Wolf: The Movie'? Tyler Posey exclusively told 'Distractify that he's hopeful he can "come back" for sequel. Source: Paramount+Fans are ready to sink their claws into more Teen Wolf content. For six seasons, Tyler Posey played Scott McCall, a high school teenager battling typical adolescent problems, but when Scott is bitten by a strange animal, he soon learns that he is a werewolf. No longer just worried about playing in the upcoming lacrosse game or scoring a date, Scott is thrown into the world of the supernatural, and the teen werewolf and his group of friends are forced to battle tough adversaries to help keep the residents of Beacon Hills safe.

item.title: Tears As Rachel Oniga Is Buried In Lagos (See Photos)
item.description: The funeral service for the late Nollywood veteran actress, Rachel Oniga was held on Friday, 27th August, 2021 in Lagos State. Born on 23 May 1957 in Ebutte Metta, Lagos State, the screen goddess died on Friday 30th July, 2021 at the age of 64 from complications involving a heart disease problem. After her death, the family of the late award-winning Nigerian actress announced her burial plans. Tunji Oniga, her son who spoke on behalf of the family of the deceased, fixed her burial for August 26 and 27, 2021.

item.title: CBN, FAAN: We Will Mobilise Youths Across All Northern States For Mass Protest
item.description: A pro-democracy northern organisation, the Joint-Action Northern Youth Associations, has rejected the relocation of key departments of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) and the headquarters of the Federal Airports Authority of Nigeria (FAAN) to Lagos. The association, comprising 16 civil society organisations in the North, such as the Arewa Defence League, Association of Northern Nigeria Students, Arewa Youth for Development and National Unity, Arewa Young Women Rights Advocate Council, Northern Youth in Defence of Democracy, Arewa Radio and Television Commentators, among others, warned that they would not stand still and watch such a development take place.

item.description: Zach Wilson is a star quarterback from Brigham Young University slated to be a first-round draft pick, but he also has a religious background. Is he Mormon? item.title: Spain | Famous Birthdays
item.description: The second-largest country in the European Union, primarily located in southwestern Europe. Its territory also includes the Canary Islands in the Atlantic Ocean and the cities of Ceuta and Melilla in Africa.  It is the only country in all of Europe to have a physical border with an African country, Morocco. Trivia The Moors from North Africa invaded Spain in 711 AD and the country was under Muslim control for five centuries.

item.description: NFL running back who became the feature back for the Dallas Cowboys in 2011. He gained over 1,000 yards in back-to-back years for the Cowboys in 2013 and 2014, then in 2015, he signed with the Philadelphia Eagles. He was traded to the Tennessee Titans in 2016. Following his career, he became a running back coach for the Arizona Wildcats in 2019, and the University of Oklahoma in 2020. Before Fame He was named the 2005 Sunset Region Offensive Player of the Year his senior year at Bishop Gorman High School in Las Vegas.

item.title: Ikoyi Building Collapse: Corpses Ready For Identification
item.description: Lagos State has announced that bodies recovered from the collapsed Ikoyi building are now ready for identification. The Commissioner of Information and Strategy, Mr. Gbenga Omotoso, revealed this to newsmen at the site of the collapsed building. He stated that the bodies were made available in the Infectious Diseases Hospital (IDH), Yaba and an autopsy will be carried out on them before releasing them to their families. The commissioner said: “The autopsy is important because the law says that whenever there is death, as a result of such incidents like the collapsed building, an autopsy must be done before the body is released.

Scientists create third embryo of endangered northern white rhino using eggs from Kenya
item.description: - Scientists extracted 10 eggs from remaining female northern white rhinos Najin and Fatu in Ol Pejeta Conservancy - The eggs were flown from Kenya to a laboratory in Italy to be fertilised with preserved frozen sperm - The team created two embryos out of the 10 ova awaiting to be transferred into a surrogate mother Hope to save the northern white rhino has been restored after a team of wildlife conservationists successfully created additional pure embryo.

item.title: Buni Returns To Nigeria, Makes First Statement After Medical Leave
item.description: The executive Governor of Yobe State, Mai Mala Buni, has returned to Nigeria after days in abroad for health purposes. Belgium To Spend 5m On North-East Annually
item.description: The kingdom of Belgium has approved €5m annually to help in the redevelopment of areas in the North-East of Nigeria affected by Boko Haram insurgency. Daniel Bertrand, the Ambassador of Belgium to Nigeria made this known in Abuja on Wednesday during a courtesy visit to Mohammed Alkali, the Managing Director of the North East Development Commission (NEDC). He said: “We’re not indifferent to what is happening in the North-East part of the country, especially from the humanitarian point of view, we are at the disposal of the Nigerian authorities to do better.

item.title: Dasuki Lists Bode George, Odili As Accomplices In Arms Deal Scandal
item.description: Chief Bode George, a chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and the former Rivers state governor Peter Odili have been named among beneficiaries of about N100 million each from the embattled former national security adviser Sambo Dasuki. item.title: New Year's Eve - Facts, Info, Trivia
item.description: Annual festivity celebrated across the world with varying traditions. The holiday celebrates the final day of the year according to the Gregorian calendar, which is the predominantly observed calendar across the world.  Trivia In the U.S., the most well-known celebration is on Times Square in New York City, where a mechanical ball slowly drops during the last minute of December 31. There are multiple TV specials that cover the ball drop, including Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve, which was hosted by Dick Clark almost every year from 1973 to 2012.

Family Life She married David A. Stewart in 1987 but they divorced in 1996. They had two sons, Sam and Django James.

item.title: Southwest Passenger Accuses Fliers of Wheelchair "Scam" So They Can Board Early
item.description: A Southwest Airlines passenger accused several fliers getting ready to board of lying about needing wheelchairs. Source: Twitter @trendreadyFor some reason, there are people at the airport who want to board their plane before every other passenger. Why anyone would want to spend any more time than they have to in a confined cabin seat may seem like a psychotic way to spend their time to some, but there are folks who will go to extreme lengths to make sure they're the first to board.

item.title: Why Im Supporting Govt To Combat Sit-at-home In South East Ifeanyi Ubah
item.description: Senator representing Anambra South Senatorial District, Ifeanyi Ubah, has said he supports the state government in the fight against sit-at-home and insecurity in the South-East region. Ubah, in an interview with Channels Television’s Sunrise Daily, said his initiative was intended to augment the existing mechanisms of the Anambra state government to curb the insecurity crisis in the state and the South-East region at large. He said, “For me, in Anambra State, my coming on board is to add to what the governor or the government of Anambra is doing.

item.title: Is 'Good Girls' on Peacock? Fans of the Show Miss It Already
item.description: Already Missing 'Good Girls'? item.description: Amidst the crisis rocking the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), a former Senate Minority Leader, Biodun Olujimi has begged Rivers state Governor, Nyesom Wike, as well as other aggrieved members of his team, to make peace and support the party to win the 2023 presidential election. Naija News reports that Olujimi said she understands that Wike and other aggrieved members of his team were fighting for justice, equity and fairness in the party.

After all, it’s pretty annoying to deal with people failing to practice proper gym etiquette — from cleaning machines after use to rushing folks off of machines.

Naija News recalls that in September, an Instagram blogger alleged that the marriage between Isreal and his wife had collapsed over allegations of domestic violence. According to the blog, Sheila was in a romantic relationship with another man before her father encountered Isreal DMW, who was driven by his wealth and connections to Davido.

item.title: Wike Is A Controversial And Rascally Politician But I'm His Senior Brother
item.description: Former Imo State Governor, Senator Rochas Okorocha has praised Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike as a dogged and astute politician. He added that Wike is a controversial Nigerian politician known for his political rascality and doggedness. Speaking on Monday during the commissioning of Rumueche/Rumuakunde Ohna Awuse Road in Emohua Local Government Area of Rivers State, Okorocha added that he is a senior brother to Wike but may not possess the notorious behavioural pattern of the Rivers State Governor.

item.title: Atiku In Closed-door Meeting With PDP Govs Over Running Mate
item.description: The presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar is reportedly in a closed-door meeting with governors elected under the opposition party to deliberate on pressing issues ahead of the 2023 polls. Naija News learnt that the meeting which started at about 2:30 PM in Abuja today was aimed at addressing issues surrounding the candidate’s choice of running mate. A notice of the meeting according to Vanguard, was put out earlier today by the Secretariat of the PDP Governors Forum and signed by the Director-General of the PDP GF, CID Maduagbanam.

item.title: Michelle Obama - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Former First Lady of the United States of America who married Barack Obama, the 44th President of the United States of America, in 1992. She took a leading role in the "Let's Move!" initiative, which attempts to fight against childhood obesity, and has been a strong advocate for the rights of veterans and the LGBT community. Before Fame She was salutatorian of her high school, studied at Princeton and Harvard Law School, and worked at the Sidley Austin law firm.

item.title: Nigerians React As Whitemoney Goes Down On His Knees In Dubai Airport After First Trip Abroad
item.description: Fans of the reality star, Whitemoney, have hailed him for showing an attitude of gratitude after a video of him giving a prayer of thanksgiving to God for leaving the shores of Nigeria for the first time. Naija News reports that some ‘Shine Ya Eye’ Housemates are currently on an all-paid trip to Dubai, courtesy of the tasks won while they were still in the Big Brother Naija House. In the now-viral video, Whitemoney who was donning the symbolic Nigerian green was pictured on his knees with his hands lifted up in gratitude after they touch down at Dubai.

item.title: Ini Edo, Chinenye Nworah 'Fight' Over Ownership Of Netflix Movie, 'Shanty Town'
item.description: Nollywood actress Ini Edo is reportedly embroiled in a legal battle with her colleague, Chinenye Nworah, over the ownership of their 2023 Netflix series, ‘Shanty Town’. Naija News learnt that Ini had written a cease and desist letter to Netflix and asked the streaming platform not to sign a deal with Nworah for the sequel of the series. According to the letter which Channels TV obtained, Ini Edo claimed that 5 percent of the proceeds belong to the producers and not just Nworah.

item.title: President Buhari meets APC senators (photo)
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari met with senators on the platform of the All Progressives Congress (APC) at Aso Rock Villa on Wednesday, July 25. The meeting is reportedly related to the mass defection of senators on the platform to the Peoples Democratic Party and the African Democratic Congress. READ ALSO: Mass defection: We are meeting Dogara, Saraki - Former Jonathan's minister There has been report that some senators may soon leave the APC particularly Shenu Sani who was seen at the meeting.

item.title: Seyi Makinde Disappoints Deputy, Picks New Running Mate
item.description: Governor of Oyo state, Seyi Makinde has revealed who will be his running mate in the upcoming 2023 elections. Makinde announced Barrister Bayo Lawal, one of his appointees and the chairman of the State Housing Corporation, as his running mate thereby dumping his deputy Engineer Rauf Olaniyan. Lawal, as reported, was one of three other persons widely rumored as possible replacements for the deputy governor. Recall that on May 25th Makinde emerged as the flag bearer of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) for Oyo.

item.title: EFCC Operatives Tries To Re-Arrest Abdulrasheed Maina
item.description: The move by operatives of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission to re-arrest the convicted former Chairman, Pension Reformed Task Team, Abdulrasheed Maina, stirred drama at the premises of the Federal High Court, Abuja on Monday. Recall that the Federal High Court on Monday sentenced Maina to eight years imprison for money laundering. The presiding judge, Justice Okon Abang, in his ruling in the suit filed by EFCC against Maina, sentenced him to cumulative eight-year imprisonment.

item.title: How to Get There and Attend the "Adult" Camp!

item.description: - Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala speaks on Nigeria's economic crisis at George Washington University, USA - Okonjo-Iweala says Nigeria saved $22 billion under ex-president Olusegun Obasanjo, which saved the country in 2008, when there was global economic meltdown - The former Finance minister says the same feet couldn't be achieved in the time of former president Goodluck Jonathan - She gives reasons why Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, former minister of finance, on Thursday, April 14, said the zero political will to save under former president Goodluck Jonathan is responsible for Nigeria's economic challenges, The Cable reports.

item.description: Marriage is full of compromise and a union where two love birds decide to make their relationship public, official and permanent until death. Relationships these days are short and barely last more than six months since finding true and genuine love has become like a game of heartbreaks and not all couples dating get married. Sarah Hassan wedding was one of the most lavish ones in Kenya and sure enough she deserved it.

item.title: World Bank warns more than half of Kenyans could fall into poverty
item.description: - Word Bank stated more needs to be done to ensure number of poor people is cut in the country - The international lender noted individuals living in counties in north-eastern Kenya were the most affected - The bank recommended enrolling more people in social protection programmes as one way of curbing poverty More than half of Kenyans could fall into poverty in the next two years if urgent measures are not taken by the government, a new report by World Bank has revealed.

item.title: Sarah Vaughan - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Known by nicknames like Sassy and Sailor, Vaughan was a jazz singer who was the recipient of the NEA Jazz Masters Award in 1989 for her exceptional contributions to American music. Before Fame She played at Newark night clubs as the pianist even though she was underaged. Trivia She won the Grammy Award for Best Jazz Vocal Performance, Female. Family Life She married four times: first to George Treadwell in 1947, then to Clyde Atkins in 1958, then to Marshall Fisher in 1971, and finally to Waymon Reed in 1978.

item.title: Uhuru Kenyatta reveals he has family ties in Jamaica
item.description: - President Uhuru arrived in the Caribbean nation on Monday, August 5, for a two-day state visit - The head of state held bilateral talks with his host Andrew Holness, Jamaican prime minister - The two leaders signed an MoU in area of sports, tourism and culture as well as transport - Uhuru invited Jamaican investors and urged them to start seeing Kenya as an economic hub President Uhuru Kenyatta and his host Jamaican prime minister Andrew Holness held bilateral talks on Monday, August 5, purposely to deepen ties and economic partnership.

Blame Obasanjo For The Failure In Power Sector Atiku
item.description: Former vice-president Atiku Abubakar, has blamed his former boss, Nigeria's ex-president, Olusegun Obasanjo, for the prolonged crisis in the power sector. Atiku, who served under Obasanjo's regime from 1999-2007, said this in an interview with Punch on Sunday, May 24, where he alleged that the latter's adoption of a reform modeled after the gas power stations resulted in the lingering power crisis in the country. item.title: December 24 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: While selecting a career path is one of life's greatest challenges, you should take refuge in the fact that your natural abilities give you the chance for success in variety of careers. Intelligent and determined, you may want to pursue a career in business, management or administration. Additionally, your patience may be well-suited for careers like teaching, politics or education. If you have developed your writing skills, a careers as a journalist or author may be rewarding, which was the case for Marry Higgins Clark, who was also born on December 24th.

item.title: If Not For Nigerian Leaders, I Would Have Won Grammy Years Ago
item.description: Award-winning singer, Burna Boy on Saturday disclosed that he would have won a Grammy in 2013 if Nigeria had leaders that take the youths seriously. Recall that the talented singer won the ‘Best Global Music Album’ category at the 2021 Grammys. Burna Boy while speaking during an interview with BBC Africa said he would have on the award if the right environment was created by our leaders. He said: “If the environment was conducive and we had leadership who took the youth seriously and certain infrastructure in place, I probably won’t be winning a Grammy in 2021.

item.title: 'Judiciary's Reputation At Stake' - NBA Decries Conflicting Court Orders
item.description: The Nigerian Bar Association (NBA) has called on politicians in the country to stop using lawyers to ridicule the judiciary under the guise of seeking justice. Naija News had reported that the Chief Justice of Nigeria (CJN), Justice Ibrahim Muhammad, summoned six Chief Judges over conflicting orders emanating from their courts of co-ordinate jurisdictions. Confirming the summon, media aide to the CJN, Ahuraka Yusuf Isah, said Muhammad is requesting the judges to explain their recent court orders.

item.title: APC Refuses To Open Defense Against Atiku's Petition
item.description: The All Progressives Congress (APC), on Wednesday through its chief lawyer, Prince Lateef Olasunkanmi Fagbemi, declined to present a defence in the case brought against them by the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and its presidential candidate, Abubakar Atiku, regarding the conduct of the February 25 presidential election. APC stated that the petitions of the PDP and the Labour Party were not worth responding to. The decision to not open defence came after the cross-examination of the Senate Majority Leader, Michael Opeyemi Bamidele, a key witness for President Bola Ahmed Tinubu.

item.description: Instagram doesn't notify you when someone has blocked your account, so here's how to know if a specific person has blocked you on Instagram. Sometimes your Instagram feed needs a bit of a refresh. Maybe it's clogged up with too many people you went to high school with getting married and starting families. Or maybe you've just noticed that your 7th-grade ex-boyfriend has liked every single one of your posts for the last year and started fire reacting to all of your stories.

item.title: What Happened to Miep Gies and Her Husband Jan?
item.description: What happened to Miep Gies and her husband? They helped Anne Frank's family go into hiding during WWII, and Miep saved Anne's diary. Source: Rob Bogaerts / Anefo / Wikimedia CommonsThe late Miep Gies's given name was Hermine Santrouschitz and as historians have recounted, she would go on to work for Otto Frank, Anne's father, in the Netherlands. Miep later married Jan Gies and famously helped the Frank family go into hiding during World War II.

item.title: Nnamani, Chime To Lead Tinubu's Campaign In Enugu
item.description: A former Senate President, Senator Ken Nnamani, and former Governor of Enugu, Sullivan Chime, will lead the presidential campaign of the All Progressives Congress (APC) presidential candidate, Ahmed Bola Tinubu, in the state. Former Chairman of Enugu chapter of the APC, Ben Nwoye made this known to newsmen on Wednesday after the inaugural meeting of a Tinubu/Shettima Support Group in Enugu. Nwoye, Coordinator of the Tinubu/Shettima Independent Campaign Group in Enugu, disclosed that other APC chieftains that would be part of the campaign are the Director General of the Voice of Nigeria (VON), Osita Okechukwu, Senator Ayogu Eze, among others.

item.title: Woman Discovers Massive Floor Hole While Test Driving a Car
item.description: One woman found a hole in the floor of a used 2005 Ford Taurus that she was test driving. Did the seller really think she wasn't going to notice? item.title: 20 most beautiful countries in the world (with pictures) 2022
item.description: What is the most beautiful country in the world? Since beauty is a subjective term and is a hard thing to quantify, United Nations agencies like UNESCO organizations like the World Economic Forum help us discover the most beautiful countries in the world. They use various factors like the natural resources, architectural designs of modern and ancient structures, vegetation, wildlife, and landscapes to determine a country's beauty. Before UNESCO and the World Economic Forum enlists a nation as one of the prettiest countries in the world, they consider factors like safety, life expectancy, conservation of natural resources, and how eye-catching the natural sites are.

item.title: Naira Falls To 1,035/$ At Official Market
item.description: The Nigerian currency, Naira, experienced a significant drop, reaching N1035.12 against the US dollar at the official Nigerian Autonomous Foreign Exchange Market (NAFEM) window on Wednesday. This decline represents a 4.72 percent decrease from the N988.46/$ rate recorded on Tuesday, the first trading day of 2024. The FMDQ Securities Exchange reported fluctuations in the official FX trading, ranging from a low of N700 to a high of ₦1,224 per dollar.

item.title: PDP Files Fresh Suit Against APC
item.description: Nigeria’s main opposition, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), has filed a fresh suit against the All Progressives Congress (APC), asking the Federal High Court in Abuja to sack the party’s National Working Committee (NWC) led by Abdullahi Adamu. In the fresh suit, Naija News reports that PDP accused the ruling party of illegality in the process that produced the party’s national officers and candidates. The suit filed by a Senior Advocate of Nigeria (SAN), Ayo Kamaldeen Ajibade, on PDP’S behalf, demanded that all candidates produced by APC for the 2023 general elections be disqualified from the race, having been allegedly produced in breach and gross violation of the 1999 Constitution and Electoral Act 2022.

item.title: Princess Shyngle Reveals Why She Aborted Her Baby
item.description: Gambian actress, Princess Shyngle has revealed that she had to surgically remove her baby because it was an ectopic pregnancy. She also said she was truly excited because the baby was supposed to be born around December/January. However on the 27th of June she began to feel serious abdominal pain and rushed to the hospital to seek medical help, when she got there, the doctor examined her and found out she had an ectopic pregnancy.

item.title: Uhuru, Central Park Closed for 3 Months Ahead of Renovation Works
item.description: On Wednesday, September 28, members of the Nairobi County Assembly unanimously passed the motion so that the two parks at the heart of the city get a facelift Majority leader Abdi Guyo, who was the mover of the motion, called for immediate closure of the parks to allow restoration to their former gloryThe motion was seconded by minority leader Michael Ogada who said that the renovations would be undertaken for approximately three months Nairobi County Assembly has approved a motion that will see Uhuru Park and Central Park closed for three months ahead of scheduled renovation works.

item.title: Nigeria Becomes Country With Most Islamic State Attacks, Overtakes Iraq
item.description: Jihad Analytics in its latest report claimed that Nigeria has overtaken Iraq as the country with the highest number of attacks by the Islamic State (IS). item.title: Netizens Agog With Excitement, Mention Davido's Name As Wizkid Announces Collabo With Unidentified M
item.description: A video making the rounds on social media has shown the moment Wizkid confirmed that he has an upcoming album with someone people feel he is not friends with. In the short clip, the singer explained that people often assumed that he is not in good terms with the yet-to-be identified singer because he has never done a song with him. He, however, announced that contrary to what people think they are actually good friends and have done a collabo together that will soon be released.

item.title: Pastor Kumuyi Has A Message For Nigerians
item.description: The General Overseer, Deeper Life Bible Church, Pastor Williams Kumuyi, on Sunday urged Nigerians to always resort to prayer to resolve the problems confronting them individually and as a nation. Kumuyi gave the charge during a special programme held at the church headquarters in Abuja. He said that worry and anxiety could not bring solutions to the challenges facing individuals or the nation but prayer was necessary to turn things around.

item.title: Jeffrey Chang - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Internet star who became famous for posting comedic videos to his popular YouTube channel, JeffreyFever. He also became known as a singer and ballroom dancer and has been featured on TV shows like The Ellen Degeneres Show and the first season of Canada's Got Talent. He has earned over 1.7 million followers for the singing, dance, vlog, transition and fashion videos he posts on his jeffreychangofficial TikTok account. item.title: Akeredolu Sacks All Political Aides, Makes Fresh Appointment
item.description: Governor Rotimi Akeredolu of Ondo State has sacked all his political appointees, thanking them for their selfless service and dedication to the service of the State. In a statement by his Chief Press Secretary, Richard Olabode Olatunde, stated that the sacking of all political aides was with immediate effect. The affected appointees include Personal Assistants, Special Assistants and Senior Special Assistants. The governor has also approved the appointment of Bola Alabi as the new Chief of Protocol and Mrs.
