item.title: Pilot makes emergency landing without front wheel of plane with 89 people on board
item.description: - The plane's landing gear failed and the pilot had to improvise - He ended up landing the plane without the aid of the front wheels - A video shared online shows the landing before the jet's nose tipped over and grounded to a halt A Myanmar-based pilot will go down as one of the real heroes in modern era after he somehow managed to make an emergency landing with a plane which lacked its front wheels.

item.title: Super Eagles Of Nigeria Starting XI Against Cameroon
item.description: Super Eagles head coach, Jose Peseiro has announced his starting XI for the much anticipated 2023 AFCON round of 16 clash with their West African rivals, Cameroon. The Super Eagles qualified for the round of 16 after drawing 1-1 with Equatorial Guinea, beating the hosts, Ivory Coast, 1-0 and then beating Guinea-Bissau 1-0 in their last group stage game. At 9 p.m. tonight, Jose Peseiro and his boys will face Cameroon who have conceded 6 goals in the competition.

item.title: We will not stop even after Fagge's directive UNIJOS Chapter of ASUU.
item.description: Dr. David Janakam, the Chairman of the UNIJOS chapter, stated this in an interview in the capital city of Plateau State – Jos. “The National President of ASUU cannot ask us to call off just because the Union has met with Mr. President. We don’t operate that way. Whatever agreement reached between the national body and Mr. President will be a subject of discussion at local branches. “We can only call it off when the local branches give their acceptance to whatever agreement reached with the Federal Government in their last meeting with President Jonathan.

item.title: Party Leaders Consider Ayu Meeting Wike
item.description: Leaders in the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) are considering the National Chairman of the party, Iyorchia Ayu should meet with the Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike. The party leadership is taking the step as the 2023 general campaign season draws closer. The camp of Governor Wike in its demand to support the party in the forthcoming election had requested for the party National Chairman, Ayu to resign from office. The move was, however, truncated after members of the party’s National Executive Council (NEC) passed a vote of confidence on Ayu.

item.title: President Buhari Increases Npower Budget (Full Details)
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has approved the increase of the budget of social investment scheme, Npower, by N365 Billion. Naija News reports that the Buhari-led government announced the increment in a post via his official Twitter handle @MBuhari on Friday. Buhari disclosed this while discussing deliberate actions taken to expand the nation’s fiscal budget for 2021. “Yesterday, I assented to the 2021 Appropriation Act and the Finance Act 2020. item.title: What Jonathan, Saraki, Dankwambo, Others Discussed In Closed-door Meeting
item.description: Other members of the committee include one-time Senate President, Anyim Pius Anyim, and ex-governor of Cross River State Liyel Imoke as members. Former Gombe Governor Ibrahim Dankwambo; ex-Katsina Governor Ibrahim Shema and Hon. Mulikat Akande. Speaking to newsmen after the meeting, Saraki said the committee sought Jonathan’s counsel on how to go about strengthening the party, by reconciling aggrieved members. He said: “Jonathan gave us his views and we are very happy. He reassured all of us of his commitment to the PDP and he told us that he is still ready to offer his time, experience and resources to strengthen the party.

item.title: Makinde Does Not Deserve Re-Election
item.description: Oyo State’s main opposition party, the All Progressives Congress (APC) has said that Governor Seyi Makinde does not deserve re-election for a second term in office come 2023. APC in a statement obtained by Naija News on Monday said the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has failed woefully in the state, hence another chance to lead will breed serious insecurity in Oyo State. The statement issued by the APC State Secretary in the state, Alhaji Tajudeen Olanite, said PDP is out to silence opposition and turn Oyo into a one-party state.

This is coming hours after the Nollywood actor revealed the identity of his second wife, Judy Austin and their son. Edochie while announcing his new son noted that he loves him as much as he loved his older four children, which he shared with his first wife, May. He wrote, “It’s time for the world to meet my son.

item.title: Boko Haram Terrorists Declare Borno Town As West African Caliphate Headquarters
item.description: Dreaded Boko Haram terrorists have reportedly taken over Gudumbali in Borno State, and have declared the town as its West Africa caliphate headquarters. The report sighted by Naija News on SaharaReporters on Monday morning revealed that a faction of Boko Haram, the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), has made Gudumbali its Manhaja Jundun Khilafah Wylaya West Africa (Caliphate headquarters). Gudumbali is the headquarters of Guzamala Local Government Area of Borno State and is located approximately 125 kilometres north of the state capital, Maiduguri.

item.title: Nigeria To Make 66bn Daily As Crude Oil Price Hits $93
item.description: Nigeria has witnessed the highest increase in the price of crude oil, a percentage said to be the highest of its kind in the last seven years. Due to the development, there is a prospect the country could make sixty-six billion from crude oil per day henceforth. Naija News understands that the price of Brent appreciated by $2.16 or 2.37 per cent to $93.27 per barrel last Friday. This occurred in the midst of the Russia-Ukraine conflict and a strong cold in Texas, which halted some US oil output.

item.title: Who Would Protect The People? Buhari Asks
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has condemned the attack on security operatives and security formations in some parts of the country. In a statement on Sunday, Buhari lamented that there is madness going on in some parts of the country. The statement which was released by Buhari’s Special Assistant on Media and Publicity, Garba Shehu, was in response to recent attacks on police stations and security institutions in the South-East region. while condoling with those who lost family members to the ravaging insecurity in the country, Buhari wondered who would protect the people.

item.title: Buhari Reveals When Boko Haram, Bandits Will Be Defeated
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has stated that Boko Haram insurgents and bandits in the northwest will be defeated before the year 2021 ends. Buhari made this known when speaking during the Juma’at Prayer for the 2021 Armed Forces Remembrance Day Celebration at the National Mosque. The president who was represented by the Defence Minister, Major General Magashi Salihi called for prayers for the Armed Forces of Nigeria to enable them to end the war against insurgency.

I moved on from there and became the classroom voice all through secondary school and I would sing and entertain my friends whenever we had free time in school.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu's Former Deputy, Mefor Declares IPOB Cursed
item.description: Erstwhile right-hand man of Nnamdi Kanu, the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Uche Mefor, on Wednesday said IPOB is cursed. Mefor, in a post on his Facebook account on Wednesday, said he has withdrawn his blessing from the group. Kanu and Mefor who is the head of Information and Communication of the new Customary Government of Biafra, clashed with the IPOB leader last year due to his method of operating the group.

item.title: 'Fake News': Buhari Has Not Rejected Electoral Bill
item.description: The Presidency has denied a media report that President Muhammadu Buhari has rejected the Electoral Amendment Bill. Naija News reports that the Presidency was reacting to a report that the President had rejected the bill and transmitted it back to the leadership of the National Assembly. In an interview with Daily Trust on Thursday, Senior Special Assistant to the President on National Assembly Matters (Senate), Babajide Omoworare, said the report is fake and should be disregarded.

item.title: Fayose Visits Ekiti Governor, Oyebanji, Extends Hand Of Fellowship
item.description: Former Ekiti State Governor, Ayodele Fayose has visited Governor Biodun Oyebanji following his inauguration on October 16, 2022. A statement signed by the Chief Press Secretary to the governor, Olayinka Oyebode, said Fayose was on Monday welcomed to the Governor’s Office in Ado- Ekiti, the state capital. The statement said Fayose, who paid a courtesy visit to Oyebanji, urged Ekiti people to support the Governor so that he can improve the economic situation of the state and deliver on his promises to move the state forward.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu Makes Fresh Appointment
item.description: Nnamdi Kanu, the leader of the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), has announced the appointment of Amaka Ekwo, as his Press Secretary. Naija News reports that Kanu made Ekwo’s appointment known in a post on the micro-blogging site, Twitter on Monday, July 22. The IPOB leader who doubles as the director of Radio Biafra said the “Biafran” was appointed because he “trust she will continue to do a brilliant job.

item.title: Resident Doctors Refuse To Sign FG's New Agreement, Reveal Why
item.description: Striking doctors under the aegis of the National Association of Resident Doctors have explained why they rejected the fresh Memorandum of Understanding presented for their endorsement with a view to ending their three-weeks old industrial action. The NARD President, Dr Okhuaihesuyi Uyilawa, said accepting the government’s new offer would have amounted to them paying for the government’s failure. He said, as medical doctors, they were not after crippling the nation’s health sector, but insisted that they could not sign the new MoU because of the introduction of an undisclosed clause in the agreement.

item.title: Buhari Is Incompetent- APC Senator Declares
item.description: Senator Bima Enagi (APC-Niger South) has described President Muhammadu Buhari as incompetent when it comes to tackling insecurity. Naija News reports that at around 2 am on Tuesday, gunmen attacked the Federal Government College of Science, Kagara, Rafi Local Government Area of ​​Niger State. The assailants raided staff dormitories, dormitories, gathered them in one place and drove them into the desert to an unknown location. An eyewitness said the attackers shot a student who tried to escape during the attack at around 3 am.

item.title: How Boko Haram Have Killed Since Buhari's Inauguration
item.description: Since the inauguration of President Muhammudu Buhari on May 29, over 500 people including soldiers have been killed by Boko Haram forces either through bombings, beheading or shootings. The Jos resturant bombing this morning has taken the official death toll to 505 people but such numbers cannot be totally relied upon which makes speculations that over 500 people killed by the insurgents more attainable. On Sunday, a bomb explosion at a Redeemed Christian Church of God in Potiskum Town, Yobe State by a male suicide bomber killed six persons.

Naija News understands that this is second meeting between the duo in recent times. A media aide to Kwankwaso, Saifullahi Hassan, confirmed the latest meeting via his Facebook page and shared photos of the duo which he claimed they took at the presidential villa in Abuja yesterday.

item.title: APC Loses Senatorial Candidate, Gaya To Death
item.description: The Jigawa State chapter of the All Progressives Congress has lost its senatorial candidate for Jigawa Central, Tijjani Ibrahim Kiyawa to death. A family source that spoke with Daily Post disclosed that Kiyawa died on Saturday around 11 pm. The APC candidate died in a hospital in the Federal Capital Territory after suffering from illness. Kiyawa served as a member of the House of Representatives for Dutse and the Kiyawa Federal constituency from 2011-2015 under the Peoples Democratic Party PDP.

item.title: APC Vows To Support Binani, Others In 2023
item.description: The Adamawa State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) has vowed to support its gubernatorial candidate, Sen. Aishatu Dahiru Ahmed Binani and all its flag bearers in the 2023 general elections. The party took its stand to support Binani and all its flag bearers after meeting with the party’s critical stakeholders at the Asokoro residence of Sen. Aishatu Dahiru Ahmed Binani. The group also congratulated the Senator on her victory.

item.title: Young Suicide Bomber Kills 8 At Potiskum Market In Yobe
item.description: A suicide bomber on Sunday, February 22, detonated an explosive device at the GSM market in Nigeria’s northeastern city of Potiskum, Yobe state, killing 8 and injuring 42 people. Reportedly, the suicide bomber, suspected to be a Boko Haram member, was a young girl from 7 to 10 years old. According to the Eagle Online, the female suicide bomber struck at about 1:20pm when the market was in full swing. A witness said that the lady, who was said to be about eight years old, refused to be checked at the gate to the Kasuwan Jagwal market.

item.title: 'Drama As Contradictory Rulings In CTC Of Judgment Sacking Kano Governor Emerge'
item.description: The Certified True Copy (CTC) of the Court of Appeal judgment delivered on the Kano State governorship election has stirred confusion, following its release by the court. Naija News recalls that the appellate court sacked the Kano State Governor and candidate of the New Nigeria People’s Party (NNPP), Abba Kabir Yusuf, in its judgment delivered on Friday. However, in the CTC of the judgment released on Tuesday, several rulings of the court in the judgment appeared to be contradictory.

item.title: Bandits Taking Their Time, We Can't Rush Them- Niger Govt
item.description: The Niger State Government has stated that it cannot rush bandits to release the students and staff of Government Science College Kagara, Niger State. In a chat with DailyTrust, Alhaji Ibrahim Matane, Secretary to the Niger State Government, said the bandits are taking their time. This is despite President Muhammadu Buhari’s directive that the students and staff should be rescued immediately. Matane said the state government was doing everything to make sure all the victims are released unhurt.

item.title: Court Affirms Baruwa As NURTW President
item.description: The National Industrial Court in Abuja has reinstated Tajudeen Baruwa as the re-elected president of the National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW), effectively dissolving the Tajudeen Agbede-led Caretaker Committee. The decision comes as a resolution to the protracted leadership dispute within the union, with Justice O. O. Oyewumi presiding over the case. Justice Oyewumi’s verdict confirmed the validity of the delegates’ conference held across the union’s six zonal councils on May 24, 2023, where Baruwa was re-elected for a second term.

item.title: Ex-BBNaija Housemate Tells Nigerian Celebrites How To Make Fans Get PVCs
item.description: Big Brother Naija Lockdown housemate, Prince Nelson has urged Nigerian celebrities to organize free shows across the country and impose PVC as a gate pass. The Mr Nigeria 2018, made the suggestion on the microblogging platform, Twitter where he noted that musicians and celebrities could use their influence to push the youths into participation in the forthcoming 2023 elections. According to the reality star,  to push the “get your PVC agenda”, celebrities must harness their influence with proposed concerts which will equally serve as an avenue for grass root sensitization.

item.title: Excitement As Abducted Bride Weds A Day After Her Release (Photos)
item.description: The bride who was allegedly kidnapped in Plateau State, Farmat Paul, has tied the knot with her man Zephaniah Kosom after regaining freedom from her abductors. Naija News had earlier reported that Farmat was abducted in her pastor’s house in the Bokkos local government area of Plateau State a few hours to her wedding on Monday. It was gathered that the bride regained her freedom on Monday night and the wedding was held on Tuesday, January 4th.

item.title: I'm in Parliament, Kazi ni Kukula Tu, Kimani Ngunjiri Confesses MPs are Greedy
item.description: - Ngunjiri said the Kenyan parliament lost its meaning long ago, and no MP is currently serving the interest of the common mwananchi - The Nakuru Tanga Tanga-allied legislator lamented that his colleagues in both Houses are easily bribed to pass bills - The first time lawmaker also took issue with the National Prayer Breakfast hosted by the National Assembly and the Senate leadership PAY ATTENTION: Don't miss trending Kenyan news.

item.title: Is There an Essence Challenge Filter? How to Make an Essence Cover
item.description: Forget the 'Vogue' Challenge — Here’s How to Do the 'Essence' ChallengeBy Abi TravisUpdated June 15 2020, 12:14 p.m. ET Source: Instagram/@vanlenoreChances are you’ve probably seen people participating in the Vogue challenge in your various social media feeds. The challenge involves people — especially Black creatives — Photoshopping pictures of themselves onto covers of Vogue Magazine, which has been notoriously not diverse for... basically ever. Participating in the Vogue challenge is, for many Black folks, the only way to see themselves or people who look like them represented by one of the top fashion magazines.

Country singer-songwriter Sara Evans and football player Harry “Jay” Barker are introduced to each other by Sara’s marital counselor after their respective divorces.

item.description: Did Josh and Nessa break up? The first news about potential relationship troubles emerged in March this year. Is it really over between the stars? The TikTok stars posted a new video titled "We Broke Up" on Wednesday, June 18. Josh and Nessa started dating in October 2019, although they kept the relationship a secret for the first three months. They became Instagram official in January this year.

item.title: Khadi Don - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Instagram star, aspiring actress, and musician who first used Vine to share music and comedy content. Before Fame From a young age, she uploaded comical skits and music to her YouTube page with videos reaching over 100,000 views. She continued her social media outreach from there on apps like Vine and Instagram while in school. Trivia Her success on Vine led to her creating more content on YouTube and sharing her music on SoundCloud.

item.title: Kristina Basham - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Instagram star, baker and model who has amassed over 3.9 million followers to her main Instagram and over 15,000 followers to her personal Instagram. She later opened a bakery in San Fransisco. Before Fame Starting in elementary school she ran cross country and won a gold medal for a 20 mile long race. She began modeling at the age of 11 when she was discovered in a restaurant. Trivia She attended University of California, Berkeley receiving her bachelors degree and later her masters in financial economics.

item.title: Mathenge Technical Training Institute courses, application, contacts
item.description: Opened officially in 1984 by His Excellency the late President Mwai Kibaki, Mathenge Technical Training Institute is among the famous public tertiary institutions in the country. It is one of the fastest-growing scientific and technological institutions in the country, attracting students from all over Kenya. Here is all you should know about Mathenge Technical Training Institute courses, fees, application process, and contacts. TABLE OF CONTENTSThe institute is approximately 12 kilometres from Othaya town and 18 kilometres from Nyeri town.

item.title: Mo'Nique's Parents and Siblings Have a Complicated Dynamic
item.description: Mo'Nique Has Had Rocky Relationships With Her Parents and BrothersBy Alizabeth SwainFeb. 9 2024, Published 11:08 a.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesMonique Angela Hicks, better known as Mo'Nique, has made her mark in the world of comedy and acting with her charismatic performances and unapologetic authenticity. Born on December 11, 1967, Mo'Nique's journey to stardom wasn't always glittering with Oscar awards and applause. In fact, her family dynamic growing up made Mo'Nique face a lot of difficult challenges.

item.title: Ned Luke's biography: age, net worth, movies, death rumours
item.description: Ned Luke is an accomplished film and voice actor. He is well-known as the voice character behind Michael de Santa in the video game Grand Theft Auto V (2013). Luke has also been in many movies and TV shows, with 29 credits to his name. Is Ned Luke alive? What is the story behind his career journey? Have these and more of your questions about the actor answered in his bio below.

item.title: Police Kill Notorious Armed Robber, Bugatti During Gun Battle In Imo Forest
item.description: Operatives of the Imo State Command of the Nigeria Police during a fierce gun battle, have killed a notorious armed robber terrorizing the area. The armed robber, identified as Bugatti was killed in the Nsu forest of Imo forest as confirmed in a statement on Saturday by the Imo Police spokesperson CSP Mike Abattam on behalf of the state Commissioner of Police, Rabiu Hussaini. The statement disclosed that the killed criminal was responsible for many deadly crimes in the state and had been on the wanted list of the Police for a long time.

item.title: Presidency Clarifies Tinubu's Purported Plan To Move Federal Capital To Lagos
item.description: The Special Adviser to President Bola Tinubu on Information and Strategy, Bayo Onanuga, has debunked reports that plans are underway to move the Federal Capital Territory to Lagos State. Naija News reports that Onanuga, in a statement via X on Wednesday, described those peddling the reports as dishonest, ethnic and regional champions, attempting to draw attention to themselves. He noted that the rumour had made rounds during the presidential campaign in 2023 to stop Tinubu’s presidency, but it was trashed.

item.title: Region Buhari Is Supporting To Produce Next Nigerian President Revealed
item.description: The Director-General of Voice of Nigeria (VON), Mr. Osita Okechukwu has claimed that President Muhammadu Buhari is throwing his weight behind the calls for a 2023 Igbo presidency. He dropped the hint on Sunday while speaking with newsmen in Abuja, noting that the support for Igbo presidency comes with several benefits to the government, the people of the region, and Nigeria as a whole. Okechukwu, who is also a well-known chieftain of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) however added that the President has not yet openly revealed his stand because of the activities of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).

item.title: Sara Gilbert - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actress who played Darlene Conner on TV's Roseanne. She was nominated for an Independent Spirit Award for Best Supporting Actress for her portrayal of Sylvie Cooper in the 1992 film Poison Ivy. Before Fame She decided to become an actress after seeing her older sister receive a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Trivia Her siblings, Melissa and Jonathan, starred on the TV series Little House on the Prairie. Family Life She married songwriter Linda Perry in 2014 and on February 28, 2015, the couple welcomed a boy named Rhodes.

item.title: Skip Bayless Under Fire for Disgusting Tweet Following Damar Hamlin's Collapse
item.description: What did Skip Bayless say about Damar Hamlin? After the football safety was rushed to the hospital for cardiac arrest, Skip posted an insensitive tweet. Source: Getty Images / Buffalo BillsFor those unaware, Skip Bayless is best known for his insensitive sports takes, especially those about NBA superstar LeBron James and Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers. However, his disgusting comments regarding Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin and his life-threatening injury are, without a doubt, the worst of his entire career.

item.title: Venus Williams - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Won the Australian Open and French Open singles competition in 1998 and compiled a number of tournament championships in doubles play alongside her younger sister Serena Williams. Before Fame Her family moved out of Compton so the girls could learn to play under Rick Macci. Trivia She was the first black woman to become World No. 1. Family Life Her parents are Richard Williams and Oracene Price. She has half sisters named Isha and Lyndrea.

item.title: Why Is 'Flip or Flop' Ending? Tarek and Christina's Partnership Is Over
item.description: Why Is 'Flip or Flop' Ending? Tarek and Christina Have Mutually Decided to End the ShowBy Anna GarrisonPublished March 16 2022, 11:06 a.m. ET Source: HGTVIt was only recently announced that the week of March 14, 2022, will be the last for Flip or Flop. The popular home improvement show has been on the air since 2013, but now, its stars Tarek El Moussa and Christina Haack have decided it's time for the end.

item.title: Zamfara PDP Governorship Primary Election Nullified
item.description: The Zamfara State Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) governorship primary election conducted in May 2022 has been declared null. A ruling by the Federal High Court sitting in Gusau, on Friday cancelled the processes that produced Dauda Lawan Dare as the party’s flag-bearer for the 2023 general elections, Naija News reports. The court ruling came to be following a prayer by the counsel plaintiffs, Barrister Ibrahim Aliyu. Presiding over the suit on Friday (today), the court judge, Justice Aminu Bappa explained that the court granted all the prayers of the plaintiffs and cancelled the election of Dauda Lawan Dare as the party’s flag bearer for the 2023 general elections.
